content: I think we need to do more design for the luna engine to guide our development. I am going to start an RFC document during the upcoming holidays. We can have a small discussion beforehand on these two days. Let me know if you want to join the discussion so that I can hold a meeting for it.
It seems the only appropriate time will be tonight :smile:
I think I'll be there after 9PM. If earlier, I can login and listen. Anyway, it's OK as long as the conclusion will be updated on GitHub Discussion or the RFC.
I'd like to take part in the discussion. Is there a schedule for the meeting?

Huachao Huang is inviting you to a scheduled Zoom meeting.

Topic: Luna Engine
Time: Dec 30, 2021 09:00 PM Beijing, Shanghai

Join Zoom Meeting
https://us05web.zoom.us/j/83846426632?pwd=S1FUQ1BzTTVIalc1ZHpOM0MxWU1adz09

Meeting ID: 838 4642 6632
Passcode: ZVY74c
I sent an early RFC here, you can check it first.

It seems like a mixture of several designs:

  1. spanner: separation of partition and replication
  2. spanner: "interleave table" to avoid distributed transaction
  3. Aurora: use Quorum instead of Paxos/Raft
    it's a lot of work...
Yes, it's GFS + Bigtable + Spanner + Aurora + Socrates ...
